articles.title: Russia-Ukraine war: Moscow threatens to cut gas supplies to Europe; Zelenskiy vows to stay in Kyiv until ‘war is won’ – live - The Guardian
articles.description: Ukraine president says war is ‘nightmare’ for Moscow; EU to discuss ways to wean itself off Russian gas as energy becomes key battleground; top Russian generals killed

articles.title: Russia Threatens To Cut Gas Supplies To Europe Via Nord Stream 1 - NDTV
articles.description: Russia threatened to cut natural gas supplies to Europe via the Nord Stream 1 pipeline as part of its response to sanctions imposed over the invasion of Ukraine, a move that could heighten the turmoil in energy markets and drive up consumer prices.
articles.content:
Europe's reliance on Russian energy has been a key consideration in leaders' response to the invasion.

articles.title: U.S. may act alone to ban Russian oil imports, sources say - Reuters.com
articles.description: The United States is willing to move ahead with a ban on Russian oil imports without the participation of allies in Europe, two people familiar with the matter told Reuters, in light of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

articles.title: Oil soars, stocks fall on Russia crude ban talk - news.com.au
articles.description: Stock markets lost ground while metal prices hit record highs and oil surged on Monday after the United States raised the prospect of an embargo on Russian crude over its invasion of Ukraine -- a move on which Europe urged severe caution.
